revision.comment: ==English== ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # [[barren]], not [[pregnant]], not giving [[milk]] #* '''1985''', ''The Parliamentary Debates (Hansard), Official Report, 5th Series'' (page 227) #*: With regard to the '''yeld''' ewes, untupped, may I ask the Minister what this means?
revision.text: ==English== ===Adjective=== {{en-adj|-}} # [[barren]], not [[pregnant]], not giving [[milk]] #* '''1985''', ''The Parliamentary Debates (Hansard), Official Report, 5th Series'' (page 227) #*: With regard to the '''yeld''' ewes, untupped, may I ask the Minister what this means? ---- ==Scots== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|sco|yelde|yeild|geld|ȝelde|ȝeld|ȝeild}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|sco|enm|yeld}}, from {{inh|sco|ang|ġelde|t=barren, unproductive}}, probably borrowed from {{der|sco|non|geldr|t=barren, yielding no milk}}, from {{der|sco|gem-pro|*galdaz}}, {{m|gem-pro|*galdijaz|t=barren, unfruitful}}, from {{der|sco|ine-pro|*gʰel-|t=to shout, cry}}. Related to {{cog|sv|gall|t=barren}}, {{cog|de|galt}}, {{m|de|gelt|t=yielding no milk, unfruitful}}, {{cog|non|gelda|t=to castrate}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|sco|[jɛl(d)]|[(j)il(d)]}} ===Adjective=== {{sco-adj}} # [[barren]], not [[pregnant]], not giving [[milk]] # {{qualifier|of inanimate things}} not [[fertile]], [[unproductive]], [[ineffectual]], lacking in [[substance]] or [[value]], [[unprofitable]] ====Descendants==== * {{desc|en|yell}} ===Noun=== {{sco-noun}} # barren [[ewe]] or [[cow]], etc. ===Verb=== {{sco-verb}} # to [[cease]] to [[milk]] a pregnant cow when the flow stops before calving [[Category:sco:Livestock]]
